reviewText:
I know the game is cheap, but honestly, it's the equivalent of a free, mediocre flash game from 10 years ago (which I think it might literally be). The graphics are awful, with it not being clear which screen elements are part of the UI and which are just there for looks, and the gameplay is dull and repetitive.

You basically take turns adjusting which kinds of ants you want, buying upgrades, and occasionally engaging in a random battle with bugs and such. Every part of this is dull; even the battles consist of clicking Attack" or "Retreat" and then seeing numbers change.

Also
date: if you are getting SimAnt vibes
recommended: you're wrong; it's more like a crappy business management sim that replaces business with ants. There is no real time aspect to this at all; it's just tweaking numbers and then clicking the button to move on to the next turn and see what happens.\n\nHighly advise against wasting your time on this."

reviewText:
Oh man where do I even begin?

Short Review:

Good game but not for everyone. Game is built to grind and can be repetative.
Pretty much one of the oldest clicker games out there.
Maybe get on sale (>50%)
9.5/10

Long Review

So I see many of negative reviews and I do agree with many of them, but I will have to totally recommend this little piece of gem as I grab it as soon as I saw it.

I first played this game maybe 8 or 9 years ago, don't even remember how I even got my hands on it and I totally loved it, made my day everyday seeing my colony grow and fight with the believible surroundings that you can pretty much live it as if it was real. Yes, you may probably get this game for free somewhere out there (just like many games in steam) but I just wanted to own this little gem in my library and also a way to support the devs that make my(as well as many's) childhood a little bit brighter. I mean 2$ that cost less than a cup of coffee. You have no obligation to buy this game so please don't whine about it for it being not free, no one's forcing you to buy the game.

Yes, to point out many reviews out there, that this game is indeed repetitive and is a grinding game. I mean which grinding game is not repetitive? If you don't like to grind then by all means dont get this game, no need to fill the reviews  with all the negatives its not fair for the game since you guys are just stating the obvious.

To put it in a polite way, clicker game, is better suited term than a grinding game. This maybe infact one of the oldest clicker games out there. Note that I spent over 16 hours in the game and that contribute to around 6000 days in the in-game time. Say I click around 30 - 60 clicks (combinding fights and whatnot) I spend the time clicking around 270,000 times!! I am not a fan of the clicker genre but man this game is fun and also frustating at times. I sometimes think this is one of those games that are made to make chidrends shut up.

So all in all, its a pretty decent game with hand-drawn annimations and keep in mind this is a pretty darn old game. As I mentioned, this is not a game for everyone, especially those that don't like games being repetitive. Grab it while on sale or even at full price I would say it is worth it.

9.5/10

reviewText:
So I'll get this out of the way, I myself love this game, but that is STRICTLY because I played it when I was like 7 years old. I would never recommend this game to anyone though. It's fraught with flaws.

First of all, the UI is extremely odd, and can be very confusing to navigate. The whole game is a clicking simulator, which isn't bad for some, as games of the like are usually great ways to pass the time, which is one redeeming factor the game has. The art. HOOOOOLY CRAP the art. The whole game is literally clip art images that you can easily find on google, some of which have been animated very simply (we're talking a few pivot points on some images in like, Adobe AfterEffects). The music and sound effects are maddingly repetitive, as well as the battle" sequences which are just some more clicking (if you win you get some stuff if not oh well).

Essentially
hoursPlayed: use it to waste time and only to do so. If you have some nostalgia to deal with like I did

votesHelpful: but that doesn't make it good. Sort of like loving a terrible
votesFunny: movie.\n\nTL;DR: I played this game as a kid and loved it

reviewText:
You can find my full review here.[www.the-backlog.net]

Ant War: Domination is like a clicker game combined with some strategy. You take the lead of an ant colony and must build up your army until you take over the world. You’ll need to breed ants, get food, and build up your army so that you can defend yourself from the world.

To manage your ants, you must set what percentage of each type you'll have doing that job. Gathering food and having a decent army are all pretty important. The more you grow your colony, the tougher your opponents will become.

The problem with Ant War is that is all you do. You set what percentage of each type do each job and then just watch, sometimes interacting when it comes to doing battle. Sometimes, even if you're able to win a battle, the game will still suggest you run away. The goal is so exceptionally high that it's not something you'll just complete in a few hours.

I cannot recommend Ant War: Domination at all, and I'd rather recommend you find a game that actually lets you interact a bit more. The constant Like us on Facebook!" ads also get exceptionally annoying whenever you level up
date: and really do make it feel like a flash game (perhaps because it was one)."

reviewText:
Product received for free

I was given a copy by the developer, It does not change my review.
I played this game as a child and loved it, had hours and hours soaked into this game, and I loved it then.
So what changed that made this game get a negative review then?
The game has changed none, and since I have grown I noticed the flaws
The stats mean nothing, the percentage for choosing what your ants do does nothing
The game days have no interaction from the player, besides battles, and battles are usually always attacking anyways, as it's really the easiest way to win from what i've seen, and there is no penalty from failing except for game taking longer
There is no real lose condition and no feeling of failure, it's just managing numbers and hoping to get luck
The game comes up to random chance
you can't spam the battle button anymore, and make the battles go by quickly, so the game is slower than normal
So what are some things that i like about the game atleast?
The game is atleast as I remember it, so it's kind of nostalgic, but I never see anything truly enjoyable about it now.

reviewText:
This game is a clicker, where you set your strategy, click go, and see what happens.  Then repeat.  Very casual.

I enjoyed the game somewhat, but there were a few things that lead me to not recommend:

1. Enemy strength scaling.  Their power is always based on yours and that includes when you have set aside population as soldiers so basically it's just a waste.  You will usually be underpowered and have to retreat and lose ants.  You can't feel like you have grown strong enough to dominate an area.

2.  Bonus scaling.  Bonuses per day are fixed but growth is curved, so anything you've gotten in the past fades into irrelevance.

3. Unspecific events.  Sometimes things happen but they don't always say how big an impact they had.

4. Autobattle (completely needed to battle) can only be used if the advisor thinks it's unloseable,  but that's too conservative sometimes.

reviewText:
A Reskinned Version of Age of Castles: Warlordshttps://youtu.be/pjBu-fNu9_0
This game is essentially an exact copy of Age of Castles Warlords, just reskinned with different textures and graphics.

+ Might be fun for kids or people who liked Age of Castles but want an easier more casual game.

- Copy / paste of another game
- The background graphics are very low resolution
- The animations and things going on in the stage seem kind of random....I mean there's a girl painting eggs, a dog shaking his head, and a guy hitting ants with a newspaper, none of these seem to have anything to do with the game.
- There isn't much gameplay besides changing up what % of ants have certain jobs

Overall, it's probably not that bad of a game, but I just can not recommend a game that is literally a complete rip of another game.  You can't just reskin a game and call it something else.

reviewText:
Arguably one of the greatest games of our generation.

Where do I begin? The fantastic story line of Mr. Suburbia's inner stuggle of leaving food on the counter to Farmer John trying to make a living without a face? This game has it all. Over the nearly 8 hours I played of this game I can tell you I laughed, cried, and was emotionally attached to nearly every character in this game.

Yes the graphics are poor, but this game is from 2003. What did you expect? No one talks about how bad FFVII's graphics are and this game has more depth and story than final fantasy could ever accomplish.

In conclusion, buy this game now. It's 3 dollars and you will experience a roller coaster of emotions like I have never experienced before. Thanks for reading.

reviewText:
The concept behind Ant War is good. It's a very simplistic, easy to manage strategy game that originally came out in 2003. I remember playing the original version, and enjoying it very much, however the full game was not freeware, like several people are saying.

To my knowledge, the *demo* was free, the full game needed to be bought otherwise the demo would stop your progress after a certain point, but I could be wrong. It's hard to remember exactly how I got it, but I do remember getting the full version and getting fairly far.

If you are looking for a sophisticated and challenging strategy game, Ant war certainly doesn't deliver in those departments. The visuals are lazy, the difficulty is absurdly easy, and the gui menus aren't the best either. It eventually boils down to you needing to spam click the continue button over and over with an ocassional fight, which requires even more clicking. At this point, the game feels more akin to cookie clicker or clicker heroes as you watch your numbers slowly increase.

However, if you enjoy addictive clicker style games for wasting a bit of time, Ant war does indeed deliver fun, mindless enjoyment. It's definitely not perfect, and there is clearly room for improvement in every aspect. More upgrades, better menus with more statistics, and for the love of god better art design. My biggest complaint is the nasty clip-art-♥♥♥ cartoon characters that seemed to have been made in 10 minutes in MS paint. Even the backgrounds look like random locations they snagged off of google and put filters on. If the developers decide to do anything else with this game, I would extremely recommend an art design revision.
